intro: Thyrsanthus sessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thyrsin, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often in sandy or rocky soils. It produces small, clustered flower heads that are surrounded by bracts, and it is known for its hardy, drought-resistant nature. Thyrsanthus sessilis is an important plant in New Zealand's native flora, contributing to local ecosystems and biodiversity.
